Funko Pop rolled out a new boxed set for collectors of GAME OF THRONES figures. Not the characters this time. The writers... Me, David Benioff, and D.B. Weiss.   They're calling it The Creators.  I suspect that this is the only time I will ever be as tall as David Benioff. https://t.co/G7oYMfc4sz

I received a "Retro Geffen Award" for Best Translated Fantasy! The Geffen, is presented by the Israeli Society for Science Fiction and Fantasy every year at the ICon festival.  We were unable to attend the festival, but I'm grateful to receive this honored award! https://t.co/wdklER5F0I

Harlan Ellison died in his sleep the day before last. It was a gentle ending for a turbulent soul. When he was at the top of his form, there was no finer short story writer in all of English literature. Complete tribute at: https://t.co/fxMT60pLeD https://t.co/eqao85jxD7

KNAVES OVER QUEENS , is the first ever Wild Cards novel set in the UK, and a perfect jumping-in point for readers new to this shared world – Hardcover now available  in the UK! https://t.co/hgZ0awb2xn https://t.co/UA5yGR0445

Are you an ace or a joker?

and take the test for yourself.
 https://t.co/fTo8X7Lwoa.

Alas.  I drew a black queen.
It came to my attention this link isn't working properly, apologies.  Here is a working link to the Editing with Gardner post: https://t.co/TH3vOXwaOb

It's been a big week for Wild Cards, boys and girls.  New blog post at the wild cards website:  https://t.co/nOMvQREQyE Follow the link to read all about it at my Not a Blog: https://t.co/7NbnjKn8Jf https://t.co/uP3ukh89NK

HBO has greenlit the first of the GoT successor shows, scripted by the amazing Jane Goldman.  To clarify, what we have here is a pilot order, not as yet a series order. Everybody else has already broken the news, but you can follow the link to read on https://t.co/lpP5KmQkMI https://t.co/72WdHBtaYM
#TBT at the H.R. Giger Museum in Switzerland 2014 https://t.co/fKRDFZxAZW

This is going to be an epic year for all you Wild Cards fans out there. In June we have LOW CHICAGO coming out in the US, and then KNAVES OVER QUEENS in the UK, then on October 23  it's TEXAS HOLD 'EM. check out the Wild Cards World website for all the fun https://t.co/yIqi91pyKI https://t.co/zT6ZsnzZzK

Gardner Dozois died on Sunday. Gardner and I go back a long way.  https://t.co/5VvyUFWOpu A couple of years ago at Capclave, Gardner and I and Howard Waldrop did a panel that was really just the three of us telling stories. https://t.co/WeR4CNrjJ1 https://t.co/Lee2TyUGtt

...And for those of you not into pretty pictures...  Tor Books  will have another edition of Nightflyers available today. Include 8 other Science Fiction short stories that will entice your imagination. https://t.co/Z3hlYKksqU

The illustrated edition of Nightflyers is available today here in the US.  Featuring fifteen gorgeously haunting illustrations by @dave_palumbo, this book is soon to be an original series on @SYFY https://t.co/W7x7PhGHHg

"A Journey Back to Normal  - PTSD Therapies" will have a special screening @CocteauCinema this summer. Check out their @indiegogo page to learn more about the documentary and what you can do to help if you're interested in this project https://t.co/nRzy9dvjfE

The Ice Dragon, first published 1979, holds a special place in George’s heart. Naturally we're all thrilled with the announcement that The Ice Dragon is in development as a fully animated film headed by Warner Bros. 
Read more on this story at Variety: https://t.co/hgENvXWzWj https://t.co/dQLRwYYLVp

Tonight The Great American Read, the eight part series that celebrates the power of reading, begins on @PBS Follow the link to read my Minion's post all about it. Read on, America READ ON!  #greatreadpbs  https://t.co/laieQZElg0 https://t.co/ds6czasG7R

From our Friends at Dark Sword Miniatures: "18 brand new George R.R. Martin Masterworks minis. Tom Meier,  sculptor on miniatures while Kat Martin, Aaron Lovejoy, Mary Profitt and Elizabeth Beckley-Bradford did the studio model painting honors. Enjoy!"
https://t.co/95NHjA4L25 https://t.co/vfWfhm8aQ0

There's some cool new content out there for all of you Wild Cards fans reading this.
Katie Rask has uploaded a wonderful piece on the archaeology of the Wild Cards version of New York City, post Jetboy and all that followed. Check it out: https://t.co/v6Yq9PZtnQ https://t.co/oK0vbBDVrz

Just saw online that SyFy has cancelled THE EXPANSE. It's a damn shame, especially for fans of space science fiction... of which I count myself one. It was the best space show on television, far and away.  I hope its producers can find another home for it. https://t.co/UTD1SUjyUl https://t.co/9TuJKktMBl
#TBT from the GoT premier @CocteauCinema 2015 with @Maisie_Williams https://t.co/V8oV8t0JKk

Hey, Wild Carders, we've got a brand new story for you up on https://t.co/lCMn5MRJpf:  "The Flight of Morpho Girl," by Caroline Spector and Bradley Denton. https://t.co/NheOi7mLwu The artwork, as ever, is by the amazing John Picacio.
Go, check it out, and leave a comment! https://t.co/bMC8Dho1VC

CONGRATULATIONS VALERIE, winner of the first annual Miskatonic Scholarship for horror writers to attend the Odyssey workshop. Nice to see A Game of Thrones featured on this list! https://t.co/4jr4VONEGK

This year’s Hugo nominees have been announced, and @scalzi COLLAPSING EMPIRE is one of the finalists for the “Big One” — the coveted Best Novel Award.
Haven’t read it yet? @CocteauCinema has you covered…five bucks off the cover price while supplies last. 
https://t.co/3jJ75rfs3d https://t.co/5abXJq1um6
Feeling a Draft @NFL, read more at my blog  https://t.co/fxMT60pLeD ... FYI, Please note there’s a new URL for Not A Blog,  we’re trying out a different platform. ;) https://t.co/shK85m3oae

Hot damn.
I'm a cover boy.
An ESQUIRE cover boy!
(On the Chinese edition of ESQUIRE)
Some fun pictures inside as well. And lots of text I cannot read.
Those of you who can read Chinese... enjoy. https://t.co/qCsQS9O81N

From Terra to Taos
Walter Jon Williams has picked the recipient of the first Terran Prize, the scholarship I am offering to bring writers from overseas to our Land of Enchantment.
Here's his official press release: https://t.co/smZ3MD6Y7v https://t.co/BMfi1cXRGm

The San Jose Worldcon has announced this year's list of nominations for the Hugo Awards and the John W. Campbell Award.  LOCUS has the full list of finalists at: https://t.co/n4G5HSgMJN Congratulations to all the nominees. https://t.co/isI2dJHeRp
#TBT I give you the rarely seen, highly elusive, clean shaven adult GRRM circa 1972. https://t.co/mcmQTx74T0
One of these things is not like the others. https://t.co/iJT0qWRpHR

SyFy has rolled out the first trailer for the NIGHTFLYERS tv series, scheduled to debut this fall. https://t.co/Stogl5IkIp 
Very cool to see the show coming together.  :D https://t.co/ls8lRj3iLJ

The British are coming! The British are coming!!
The British Wild Cards, that is. Aces, Jokers, Deuces, and a few Knaves too.
Oh, and an Irish guy as well. HarperCollins Voyager has scheduled the release of the latest Wild Cards anthology, KNAVES OVER QUEENS on  June 28. https://t.co/vIj3Y3Ot4E

To benefit Whale and Dolphin Conservation,  Jerome Flynn —everyone’s favorite mercenary sellsword—will join a lucky winner on a trip to Iceland to tour various  locations featured in GoT... as well as some extra treats. https://t.co/R1nxG8DNJh fundraiser ends on April 23rd. https://t.co/77jsJdHcb1
Yes, Virginia there are social media minions… https://t.co/TNmkpq2v12 https://t.co/CzuZ18cMpT

Remember those four names when you are making out your Hugo nominations for Best Professional Artist: Michael Komarck, John Picacio, David Palumbo, Bastien Lecouffe Deharme. You can find lots more examples of their art on their respective websites.

The amazing JOHN PICACIO has been doing all the "cover" art for the Wild Cards stories on https://t.co/lCMn5N9kgN. Here's his two latest, for Vic Milan's "EverNight" and Melinda Snodgrass's "When the Devil Drives." https://t.co/1JiGv6UnRo

The Wild Cards series has been blessed with some really amazing artwork.  Let me introduce you to some of our artists.
MICHAEL KOMARCK Has been our main cover artist since INSIDE STRAIGHT, and he's still hitting it out of the ballpark. Here's his cover for LOW CHICAGO https://t.co/JwsWDofwGD

David Palumbo has been building quite a buzz for his recent cover work. If you haven't seen his cover art for Nnedi Okorafor's BINTI, look it up, it's stunning. We're thrilled to have snagged him for Wild Cards. Here's his cover for the forthcoming reissue of ONE-EYED JACKS. https://t.co/uukckzc3B5

Bastien Lecouffe Deharme is another artist new to Wild Cards, but he did a knockout cover for our most recent mosaic, MISSISSIPPI ROLL. And we want to get him back for more covers! https://t.co/hVVB0KUaL9

Katie Rask wrote a lovely tribute to Vic Milan and two of his iconic Wild Cards characters over @torbooks  https://t.co/pHz6zpw9rQ Do check it out, and feel free to jump in with your own thoughts about Vic's contributions to Wild Cards, which were numerous and important. https://t.co/RDhJR4Bctz

@ThatKevinSmith I just heard about your health woes and my heart goes out to you (pun intended).  I hope you get to feeling better Sir, the world needs good comic book men like you around!  All the best wishes from Santa Fe.

Hap & Leonard are coming back! And on March 1, 7:00 pm at the @CocteauCinema  we're having a special screening of the first episode of  season 3.  Based on the stories of Joe Lansdale who will be around in person at the premiere, signing many books for the JCC bookstore :D https://t.co/Vqkc2NZ1st

Hugo Nominations Open! If you are a member of last year's worldcon in Helsinki, this year's worldcon in San Jose, or next year's worldcon in Dublin, you are eligible to nominate.  Read all about it on my blog: https://t.co/E28yWtIdZj https://t.co/pqoOA06JkG
Happy Anniversary to my lovely wife Parris. On our wedding day.  "brightest day, blackest night"  <3 https://t.co/RM7CvqI47I

As irony would have it, Vic has another story coming out today. It's a Wild Cards story called "EverNight," it saddens me that he didn't live long enough to see his story up on https://t.co/lCMn5MRJpf https://t.co/qVX1fJGX2y or appreciate the gorgeous Picacio art that adorns it. https://t.co/XA3GDekoPn

Our writing community here in New Mexico, and the world of SF and fantasy in general, took a blow yesterday when our friend Victor Milan died after two months of suffering and struggle in a series of Albuquerque hospitals. https://t.co/qCcnQpG41w It was an honor knowing you, Vic. https://t.co/iE7SFQ1jOa
When the cows come home... https://t.co/lxhgeq6ijK
#TBT The genesis of the lesser known Hippie Apocalypse https://t.co/OCk9qJmFcq

Las Vegas, beware. Meow Wolf is coming.
Hot on the heels of the unveiling of the expansion to Denver, we're thrilled to reveal that a third permanent exhibition is planned, this time at Bugsy Siegel's favorite oasis in the desert. Read all about it: https://t.co/AV4WKUEK2E https://t.co/UzJtRO1LqT

Bantam Spectra is also going to be publishing NIGHTFLYERS, as a stand-alone illustrated hardcover. The Bantam edition will also include fifteen interior illustrations and two endpapers from the astonishing and talented David Palumbo, printed in four color. Scheduled for May 29.

We had a MAD HAT CONTEST @CocteauCinema, and some of the entries were just wonderful.  You can pick up a copy of MAD HATTERS AND MARCH HARES, signed by editor Ellen Datlow and writers Stephen Graham Jones, Matthew Kressel, Katherine Vaz, and Kris Dikeman from JCC  bookstore :D https://t.co/BkBxh9Ieqv

I am pleased to announce that I am sponsoring a new annual scholarship at the Clarion West Writers Workshop in Seattle. https://t.co/NzssMv5QVX   For further details read my NotABlog post: https://t.co/agrKNKEHR4 https://t.co/R3xqq3RuNQ

With @SYFY's NIGHTFLYERS TV series fully cast & deeps in the throes of pre-production, I'm pleased to say that my original novella will be returning  first from@torbooks  reissuing NIGHTFLYERS & OTHER STORIES, with a gorgeous new cover by Stephen Youll. Publication date is May 29 https://t.co/pn8S6wyRQ8
I was very saddened to hear of the death of Ursula K. Le Guin, one of the great SF and fantasy writers of the past half century. https://t.co/G28v3GC8N7 https://t.co/dZpJEv8PzK

It’s a brand new year, and we’re proud to announce next years official calendar.  2019’s calendar will feature the stunning work of John Jude Palencar, who will bring his uniquely haunting visions of the SoI&F world eleven months from now. https://t.co/WpdZ8nhWT9. https://t.co/oVoKbLm3GY

The future belongs to all the peoples of the world.
With that in mind, I want to announce The TERRAN AWARD, which will cover all tuition and fees to the Taos Toolbox workshop here in NM. Read all about how to apply here: https://t.co/8a5hGboYDq https://t.co/8nHubrzVzP
#TBT some amazing cosplayers from a book singing during my trip to St. Petersburg last year. https://t.co/Iybn1VrQA0

Early applications are now being accepted for this summer's Odyssey Workshop, for aspiring writers of science fiction, fantasy, and horror. https://t.co/A6vXTHOwKd 
With that in mind, I am sponsoring the MISKATONIC SCHOLARSHIP.
Good luck, all you shambling horrors! https://t.co/Ee9liHcwD1

...A month later, in August, Tor will be reissuing ONE-EYED JACKS, the eighth volume in the original series, which has been out of print for more than twenty-five years.  The cover for this one is by David Palumbo. It'll be released on August 28 in trade paperback. https://t.co/5ql0g0FoDi

I thought I'd share some cool new art.  Here's the final cover for LOW CHICAGO which is the second volume in our "America" triad, and will be the twenty-fifth volume in the overall series (in the US). The cover art is by Michael Komarck. Hardcover release on June 21. https://t.co/oLg8dCKi6n
We had to say goodbye to our oldest cat last week, he was 24 and quite the impressive little rascal.  R.I.P Caligula, A.K.A Boots, we will miss you. https://t.co/7pbSj9mQgE

Hey, Denver! Da Wolf Is Coming!
It's been in the works for more than a year, but now it's official.  My friends at Meow Wolf are opening a second location, right up I-25 from us in Denver. The new Meow Wolf will not just be a duplication of Santa Fe's House of Eternal Return. https://t.co/Mw3zJHCJ1N
SyFy Channel Announces NIGHTFLYERS! https://t.co/YHon5T83uD https://t.co/b07AsXl22S

Merry Xmas and Happy New Year to all my friends and readers out there. I had a lovely Christmas Day with friends and family, and Santa was very good to me. I hope the same is true for all of you. Even so, I look forward to the new year...

... I thought 2016 was a bad year, but 2017 was even worse... if not so much for me personally, then certainly for a lot of my friends and loved ones, and for the nation and the world as a whole. I hope better times are ahead for all of us. #hopeful https://t.co/mIFPTrYgin

Nackles is my favorite anti-Santa Claus, he originates in Donald Westlake’s story “Nackles” published in 1964.  It was developed by myself and then taken over by Harlan Ellison as an episode of the 1980s Twilight Zone reboot. But,  unfortunately it never came to fruition. https://t.co/wz0SzNrB40
My minions gave me a new baby tortoise to keep Morla company.  Ladies and gentlemen, I give you Miss Morla's new baby brother, GAMERA! https://t.co/6map2ObEoh

Who says the science fiction is not prophetic?
Remember this? https://t.co/925Zbh10cu
"The secret devil of every soul on the planet all set free at once... "
The Krel Machine has been built.
We call it The Internet.

You can also read my own reflections on editing this volume at https://t.co/nOMvQREQyE https://t.co/8EGNi5wPoh

The Dragon Has Three Heads... and he's landed in my back yard.
He's a gift from m'lady Parris, and the work of a marvelous artist named Tyler Eugene Smith. I love it.   And yes, Tyler's the same amazing sculptor who made the Alfies for Spokane and Kansas City. https://t.co/DyxfJjxpWt
Back when I didn’t give a hoot. #TBT Chicago World Con 1976 https://t.co/3bxkqRZeiX

Autographed books make wonderful Xmas presents for the readers among your family and friends. With that in mind the bookstore at the Jean Cocteau Cinema is offering $5 off on half a dozen great titles, from now till Christmas... or while the supply lasts. https://t.co/rp8YmERfBe
Taking a fashion cue from Johnny Cash’s “Man in Black.” https://t.co/J6v6MRrged

The NIGHTFLYER Flies Again! I finally had the chance to sit down and break bread with the guys who are bringing NIGHTFLYERS to TV for the   writer/ creator Jeff Buhler, who scripted the pilot, and show runner Daniel Cerone, who will helm the series https://t.co/rghmsQyNgs https://t.co/yYSTHCrZ0x

Hey, hey, hey, Wild Cards fans. Good news. Today's the release of our latest all-new all-original mosaic novel: MISSISSIPPI ROLL, the twenty-fourth volume in the overall series and the first book in what we're calling the 'America Triad.' https://t.co/36c0oPHprv
